main event: A round object the size of an automobile taillight was observed in the sky over Tillamook, Oregon.
interesting points: The object changed color noticeably for 10 seconds and then began circling in ever-decreasing spirals before fading from sight.
The object was observed at an elevation of 35 degrees and an azimuth of 310 degrees.
The size of the object was estimated to be about 1/4 the size of an automobile at that elevation and distance.
The observation time was 5 minutes total.
There was a pattern of observation restriction due to the lack of sufficient elevation given by the observer, and the disappearance was attributed to atmospheric conditions.
sighted object: Round object the size of an automobile taillight
